numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph offers insight about how different generations view the future of the world.
2. The graph asks people who are 15-24 years old a question.
3. The graph asks people who are older than 40 years a question.
4. The question is whether the world is getting better with each generation.
5. The graph depicts Brazil.
6. The graph depicts Japan.
7. The graph depicts the US.
8. The graph depicts Zimbabwe.
9. In these countries, many people who are 15-24 years old say that the world gets better with each generation.
10. The graph depicts Nigeria.
11. The graph depicts India.
12. The graph depicts Morocco.
13. In these countries, few people who are older than 40 years agree that the world gets better with each generation.
14. The graph shows the percentage of people who agree with the statement.
15. Mali has a percentage of agreement that is a little more than 25%.
16. Brazil has a percentage of agreement that is a little more than 25%.
17. I wonder why the percentages in Mali and Brazil are so low.
18. I wonder why Ethiopia is much more in favor of the statement.
19. I wonder why Zimbabwe is much more in favor of the statement.
20. I am 15-24 years old.
21. I think that my friends and I have more faith in younger generations than my parents have.
22. I think that my parents have more faith in younger generations than my grandparents have.
23. This makes me wonder whether a lack of faith in the next generation increases over time.
24. The headline is "Generational Effect".
